section.name: Requirements
section.span: What do you need to run Hippo CMS?

tr.td:
Hippo CMS uses a client/server model. The client side runs in a web browser.
Firefox 3
Internet Explorer 6 and 7
Internet Explorer 7 is a faster browser, and generally renders better than 6. If possible, it's advisable to upgrade.

The Hippo development team tests Hippo CMS on Windows XP, Mac OS X and Ubuntu Linux.
If you need guaranteed support for a specific client OS (for example, in a virtualized environment), contact Hippo Support and ask for Certified Stack support, which is part of the Hippo Support License.
Hippo Certified Stack support

As a minimum configuration, Hippo CMS requires:
Intel Pentium 4
512 MB Memory
1024x768 screen resolution

Hippo CMS is a Java based server application. It runs on most operating systems that run Java. We generally test on Windows XP and Ubuntu Linux. If you need guaranteed support for a specific server OS (Red Hat, Suse, IBM, HP, Sun or other operating system), contact Hippo Support and ask for Certified Stack support, which is part of the Hippo Support License.
Hippo Certified Stack support

Intel Pentium 4, 2.0 Ghz or higher (Dual 2.0 GHz recommended)
2GB of RAM (4.0 Gb recommended)
300 MB of available hard-disk space for system storage
2 Gb of available hard-disk space for data storage (5 Gb or more recommended)
Actual requirements for a specific project may differ.

Sun's Java Virtual Machine, JVM 6 (or 5).
Sun Microsystems
If you need guaranteed support for a specific version of Java (IBM, BEA, etc), contact Hippo Support and ask for Certified Stack support, which is part of the Hippo Support License.
Hippo Certified Stack support

Hippo CMS works in Java Servlet containers or Java application servers that conform to version 2.4 of the Sun Servlet container specification.
The following containers are generally used for running Hippo CMS:
Jetty 6.1, also included in Hippo CMS quickstart-bin package.
Very useful for development and testing, sometimes also the best option for production.
Tomcat 6.0 and 5.5.
Generally used in production environments.
Get Hippo Certified Stack support if you need to use the following containers:
IBM Websphere
BEA Weblogic
JBoss
Sun GlassFish
If you're running Hippo CMS in a production environment (either clustered or not), it might be useful to get some Systems Support from Hippo. These guys know how to tune Hippo CMS to the max like no other :)
Hippo Certified Stack support

Hippo CMS uses a relational database for it's datastorage, e.g.:
Apache Derby > 10.0 is embedded and configured as default and runs "out of the box", but not intended for production environments. Sun's Java Virtual Machine, JVM 6 (or 5). Sun logo Sun Microsystems
MySQL 5.0 and 5.1, generally used in production.
If you already have a license for one of the following databases, and want to hook them up to Hippo CMS, contact Hippo for Certified Stack Support:
Oracle 9.2, 10 and 11
Microsoft SQLServer 2000 or newer
